Fixed typo in Javadoc of ValidatableResponseOptions.java (#1164)

The Javadoc of T header(String headerName, ResponseAwareMatcher<R> expectedValueMatcher) shows an example that does not compile:

```
assertThat().header("Location", response -> response.endsWith("/x/") + response.path("id"));
```

in fact, `endsWith` is not a method of response, it's an Hamcrest matcher. This small patch fixes the example in the Javadoc. I propose the fix according to one of the tests of REST Assured itself, https://github.com/rest-assured/rest-assured/blob/master/examples/rest-assured-itest-java/src/test/java/io/restassured/itest/java/HeaderITest.java#L220

Keep version of httpmime in sync with httpclient (#1107)

`httpclient` is required in version 4.5.3, whereas `httpmime` is required in version 4.5.1. `httpmime` itself depends on `httpclient`, requiring the same version as its own version. This causes the maven enforcer plugin to complain about the dependency convergence when consuming rest-assured.

Use `${httpclient-version}` for all subcomponents of `org.apache.httpcomponents`.

See-also: #813

Fix os dependant code (#971)

* Specify file encoding for maven-surefire-plugin

* Consistently use the system line separator

Previously the printed request and response output was a mix between new lines and the system line separator.
Also make use of SystemUtils.LINE_SEPARATOR from apache commons-lang3.

* Fix os dependant tests because of different line separators

Use String.format() with the %n format specifier for readability.

* Disable ResponseTimeITest on Windows

These tests are flaky (fail every now and then) on Windows due to the lower System#currentTimeMillis() precision.

* Clean up test log file and directory with File#deleteOnExit()

The LoggingToDiskTest#make_sure_logging_to_disk_works test failed,
because the log file (and thus also the log directory) could not be deleted.
The cause was an IOException due to an open OutputStream from the WriteLogsToDisk rule.

This commit moves the deletion logic to the WriteLogsToDisk rule,
which only calls File#deleteOnExit() on the log file and log directory.
This defers the cleanup so that the file and directory are properly deleted
by the JVM with a shutdown hook.
